content: Preface This section describes how to use Hugo to create a personal static document library and deploy it to GitHub.
title: Home Title

content:
Run the command Hugo new site MyDoc in any local directory to create a local document library.
Where MyDoc is the name of the document library you want to create. Run the command tree to check the directory.  Archetypes: Save default.md, header file format Content：Save blog posts (markdown files) data：Save custom template, imported toml file or JSON, yaml file layouts：Save the template files of the website static：Save static resources such as pictures and CSS config.toml：Configuration files for websites   Open git bash and run the following command to download the theme:
cd D:/Huiyuhui/MyDoc Git clone https://github.com/h-enk/doks.git themes/techdoc Run the following command to set the theme in the file config.toml.
echo ‘theme=”docsy”’ &raquo; config.toml Run the following command to generate the static pages:
hugo serve After running successfully, you can access http://localhost:1313/ to check your document.
title: Create Static Document Library

content:
1.Visit github official website to sign up your account.
2.Create your Personal repository.
3.Run the command hugo &ndash;theme=techdoc &ndash;baseURL=&ldquo;https://huiyuhui.github.io/&quot; to generate the pages.
4.Enter the folder &ldquo;public&rdquo;, and run the following command to push the local files to your repository.
git init
remote add origin https://github.com/huiyuhui/huiyuhui.github.io.git
git add -A
git commit -m &ldquo;first commit&rdquo;
git push -u origin master
5.The deployed github pages can be accessed through https://huiyuhui.github.io.
title: Configure the Static Pages to Github

content: Main Process  Environmental preparation Create personal static document library Deploy static pages to GitHub  flowchat st=&gt;start: Start op1=&gt;operation: Environmental preparation op2=&gt;operation: Create personal static document library op3=&gt;operation: Deploy static pages to GitHub e=&gt;end: End st-&gt;op1-&gt;op2-&gt;op3-&gt;e
title: Operation Process

content:
Installing Hugo 1.Visit Hugo official website to download the package, such as hugo_extended_0.80.0_Windows-64bit.zip.
2.Unzip hugo package to the folder D:hugo.
3.Open the Control Panel, and select System &gt; Advanced System Settings.
4.Setting the environment variables for Windows system.
5.Run the command Hugo version in CMD window to check whether the Hugo is installed successfully.
Installing GIT 1.Visit Git official website to download the Git package.
2.Click Next until the Git is installed completely.
title: Environmental Preparation
